original_title: GPS tracking systems for CPC owned fuel tankers by April 15: Kanchana
original_body_lines: GPS tracking systems will be fixed to all CPC-owned Fuel tankers by April 15 and all private tankers will be fixed with GPS afterward, Power and Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekara said today.
He said in a Twitter message that all Fuel stations will be required to maintain a minimum 50% of stock tank capacity.

The Minister said a progress review meeting was held with CPC and CPSTL management and officers this morning to review the fuel cargo plan for the next 8 weeks, refinery operations and fuel distribution during the festive season.
He said decisions were taken to suspend 40 fuel stations that have continuously failed to adhere to QR quotas. (Ajith Siriwardana)
